result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary hearing on November 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

4:02 PM Defendant SHANE R HEIN in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for SHANE R HEIN.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CM111, 2022CM186, 2022CM126. Statement by the Court - short discussion before going on the record, State filed a motion for joinder on the case. Court questions Atty Kapelis if his client has any objection to the motion for joinder. Statement by Atty Kapelis, has no objection to a joinder. Court will grant the joinder. Court goes over the motion to amend information filed, that will make it a felony charge. Statement by ADA McElroy - the information will add 2 felony counts. Atty Kapelis has no objection to amend the information. Court grants the amendment. Further statement by the Court, this is now a felony and the preliminary hearing needs to be addressed. Atty Kapelis requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled. Court sets 2021CM111 (which will become a felony case) for preliminary hearing on November 29, 2022 at 10:30 AM and the other 2 cases (2021CM126 & 2021CM186) for Status Hearing, same date and time.

Court adjourned at 4:04 PM.

Atty Kapelis states defendant is eligible for the public defender for 22CM126 and states he will be appointed. Court sets status hearing for November 1, 2022 at 3:30 PM - motions and witness lists due the day before. ADA requests it be a mandatory in person appearance. Court notes the scheduling order states it is mandatory.

1:08 PM Defendant SHANE R HEIN appeared by video, in custody. Atty Micheal Kapelis appears on 21CM186 and 21CM111, and will do a courtesy appearance on 22CM126.  Attorney Matthew McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court quashes all warrants. 

For 22CM126: Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant. DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $1500.00 cash bond on 22CM126 and reinstates existing bonds on 21CM186 and 21CM111. Julie Chier present in the gallery and makes statement. Statement by the Court. Court will set cases for Status and Plea Hearings on August 2, 2022 at 11:15 a.m. Court adjourned at 1:15 p.m.
Sent to GLSO on 06/03/2022.
